name: Manufacturers Trust Co. v. Old Forge Boro. (Repp et al., Appellants)
name_abbreviation: Manufacturers Trust Co. v. Old Forge Boro.

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Manufacturers Trust Co. v. Old Forge Boro. (Repp et al., Appellants).

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Schaffer,
This is a companion case of Scranton Electric Co. v. Boro. of Old Forge and Eyer & Co. v. Same, in which opinions are handed down herewith. The note for $10,000, upon which judgment in this case was entered, was originally given to Eyer & Co., as the opinion in that case will show. For the reasons there given the order of the court below refusing to interfere with the judgment is
Affirmed at appellants’ cost.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Schaffer,

attorneys: Paul C. Collins, M. J. Martin with them Ralph T. Lynch, for appellants.
Harold A. Scragg, with him Robert E. Scragg, for ap-pellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Manufacturers Trust Co. v. Old Forge Boro. (Repp et al., Appellants).
September 26, 1932:
Argued May 25, 1932.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
Paul C. Collins, M. J. Martin with them Ralph T. Lynch, for appellants.
Harold A. Scragg, with him Robert E. Scragg, for ap-pellees.
